titles: An elegy on the much lamented Sir William Waller, who valiantly hang'd himself at Rotterdam.
publisher: Printed by N.T. at the entrance into the Old-Spring-Garden,
notes: Verse: "Rise, grim Alecto, rise ('tis fit to chuse ..."
Place of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Waller, William, --  Sir, d. 1699 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
